Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: larain26
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to book my room at this hotel from the picture of the outside, but I was pleasantly surprised! The interior of the hotel is current, comfortable and clean. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations. It is within walking distance to all the attractions and restaurants downtown. The breakfast (included) was nice with the usual continental selections plus hard boiled eggs, yogurt, biscuits and gravy and GREAT coffee. The breakfast area is one of the largest I've seen with multiple seating areas; it was clean and well-stocked. The guest room was clean and comfortable - loved the multiple selections of pillows! I did not have much success with the wireless internet but I didn't need it since I was working at a local office all week. The covered parking is close and convenient. If you are in need of a nice, clean and comfortable room for an affordable price, don't be afraid to give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bucky5860
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel looks old and outdated, but don't be fooled because the interior has been updated and is clean and very nice. We were in town for the Big Ten Basketball tournament and the location was great. It was only a few blocks to walk to Bankers Life Fieldhouse and to downtown restaurants. Parking at the hotel is free. The staff was very friendly, breakfast was more than adequate and the bed was very comfortable. We had a corner room with two large walls of windows with a view of the downtown area. The only drawback was a very small and slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly & Comfortable Enviorment!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Well let me start off by saying this is one of the cleaness and best hotel i've (EVER) stayed at the front desk rep. Terrance was just the sweetest and most helpfulest such a hard worker, The room was very homey I loved the view of downtown, I also love the fact that its so close to the convention center and alot of great resturants , great selection for breakfast very nutritional.. the best part of my stay is everyone made me & my colleagues feel so welcome and we appreciate that very much :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property near downtown”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property located near downtown, just a couple of blocks walking. The neighborhood is safe and well lit at night. There is complimentary parking on the property and the hotel is in good condition for the age. The negative is you are not right in downtown, the positive is it doesn't cost as much as those downtown hotels. Save yourself some cash and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In for the dog shows”
Reviews.Author: Wheatenfool
Reviews.Content: Very personable and helpful desk gentleman. Room very nice. The elevator is almost dollhouse-sized! Very teeny! Ok breakfast. Beautiful lobby and dining area. Would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a downtown hotel without the downtown price”
Reviews.Author: doubledown1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while visiting the super Bowl Village. The good: Check in and out staff where very friendly Free parking (saves $20-25 other downtown hotels charge) Decent free breakfast. I've had better and I've also had worse. Within walking distance to central downtown and sports venues. From the hotel to the Super Bowl Village was a 7 minute walk. I felt safe the entire walk. Beds were very comfortable. Some things others may have an issue with: Parking is a little tight. I have a compact SUV and had no problem. Someone with a very large car might struggle a bit. Elevator is very small. But its only 3 stories. If able, take the stairs. Lighting in the room is not that great Our room did not have a fridge. The couple we went with had a fridge in a similar room next to us. Our room had a place for one but it was not there. If you think you need a fridge then you might want to request a room that has one. Hotel is next to Heliport. This did not bother us. You could here helicopters taking off and landing but it was only during daylight hours and I'm sure busier than normal due to Super Bowl. Walls are thin. As for some of the others that left negative comments. One said there was no closet. Our room had a closet. One person mentioned homeless people a block away. I did not see any.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ERKul25
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, the hotel was great. Clean, updated and a close walk to Super Bowl Village and downtown activities. Very friendly front desk, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: asnell515
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We came to Indy for my niece's gymnastic event and were happy from the moment we checked in. The staff was very friendly and made sure we had the adjoining rooms we requested. This hotel is right on the edge of downtown and was about $35 cheaper and well within walking distance of most everything. They gave us a map and some take out menus right away, which was nice because we were not familiar with the area. The rooms are nice and modern and the beds were very comfy. The free breakfast was very good with both hot items and pastries to choose from. The parking was also free which is always a bonus. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the convention center where we were going which was a 2 minute drive. They also have a cab service that will take you for about $5. I would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Average facility but nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: saber45
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Nov. Hotel was what Hotwire gave us. Free parking was nice to have and hotel was within walking distance of any downtown destination. We had a room with two double beds. It was adequate. The door didn't shut properly. Had to give it a shoulder nudge to get it open and shut. The closet door didn't open or shut properly either, making it a waste of time to use. The tracks on it needed maintenance. I'll be coming back to Indy but won't risk another Hotwire pick of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MCE7406
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the rep at the counter was outstanding! The exterior of the hotel may be a little different but don't let that fool you. The rep upgraded our reservation without the blink of an eye. The breakfast is plenty and within walking distance of lots of great places to eat. Will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “colts/steelers game”
Reviews.Author: kandvr
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I go to Indy 2-3 times a year for games. We have always stayed right downtown around the circle center. We decided to try this place out. First of all, we saved a minimum of $60-$70 on the cost here vs. downtown. It was a 15-20 minute walk to the center of town. Not bad if the weathers nice. It rained the entire time we were there. But we were prepared for that. Yes the elevators are very small. But they worked better than most of the hotels we have stayed at in Indy. Parking was very convienent and somewhat covered. We slept in Monday, so we missed the breakfast. The room was spacious and clean. Bed very comfortable. Shower nice, but could use more pressure. We didn't notice any excess noises from other rooms, or hallway. Although the doors do tend to slam, because they are very heavy. All in all, we would stay here again, as long as the weather is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa12
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for a wedding in Indianapolis. For the price (with a AAA membership discount) it was AWESOME. The staff was very helpful in determining what we should do, how we should get there, and where it was safe (everywhere), although one block away way a big homeless hang-out. It was perfect for walking everywhere in Indy. The location was priceless. The gym was decent. It was a one-room gym with a TV, one weight bench (I think), 2 treadmills, and a water cooler. It's also open 24/7, which was great. The room was on the smallish side, but it was clean and comfortable. The view was fantastic, and the breakfast was very nice with make-your-own waffles and fresh fruit, among other things.

Reviews.Title: “EDGE OF DOWNTOWN”
Reviews.Author: alassiegirl
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, just at the edge of the downtown and walking distance to other hotels that were $100 to $200 more per night. Free parking and continental breakfast. Friendly and accomodating staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic downtown lodging – no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: J13345
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this LQ property in downtown Indianapolis. My check-in was efficient and the staff was friendly. Also, no problems when I had to be reassigned to a different room due to some kind of plumbing issue with my first room. Parking was plentiful and free. This LQ is in a downtown location with not much around except municipal buildings, parking lots, and lone men walking around holding plastic grocery bags. In the evening, the neighborhood looked somewhat empty and dark which might be an issue for more timid solo travelers. My room was fine – it was clean and had a flatpanel television, small fridge, and microwave. The shower stream was plenty strong. I didn’t get a chance to try either the fitness facilities or the business center. I was a little concerned about noise because all the rooms overlook into a central parking courtyard but all the other guests seemed to be keeping similar hours so the evening was quiet. That was fortunate because I could hear my neighbors through the wall pretty easily – not enough to join in their conversation but enough to sense their general emotional atmosphere. Street noise wasn’t a problem either probably because this is more of a civic district rather than nightlife area. Access to the freeway on my way out was easy. Overall, I would recommend this property as a no-frills, economy stay for travelers with business in downtown Indianapolis. If I were visiting Indianapolis for personal reasons, I might choose a different property closer to my vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient to downtown”
Reviews.Author: bklvszd
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed one night at this hotel for a wedding reception at the Central Library in downtown Indianapolis. I mainly chose this hotel because of its location and the fact that it has a free parking garage. The reviews said the hotel was recently renovated and I found it at the top of the La Quintas I have stayed at before. It was clean, a good value, and in a great location. The only complaint I have is that it was rather loud and I found it hard to sleep. This was not necessarily the hotel's fault, due to the fact it was located in a downtown metropolitan area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dreamer869
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the Indianapolis 500. Free covered parking and within walking distance of downtown. Rooms were nice, nothing fancy but clean and comfortable. The stay came with a free breakfast which was typical of this type of hotel, nothing to write home about but wasn't bad either. If you are looking for a budget hotel in downtown Indianapolis I recommend this La Quinta Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The low end of the LaQ chain”
Reviews.Author: QQ1234
Reviews.Content: This is a newly renovated hotel -- but there is quite a bi tthat was not renovated like the elevator, the room layout, the parking area. The staff is OK. The rooms are not large and somewhat dismal. The breakfast is kind of standard or a lille below standard. The location is good in downtown Indy. The parking can be a real problem - especially if you have a big car. There are special rates. If you pay more than 70$, yiou have overpaid. The Internet is slow. No printer in the business center (one desktop PC with the same slow Internet)

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hilton but no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: durokiss
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay here and I'm actually laying on the comfy bed in my guest room as I'm typing this! You can tell this is an older building but the renovations they've made in the last year or so have greatly improved its appearance inside and out! The staff is always friendly and the vending machines are always stocked with munchies! Be sure you bring a roll of Charmin ultra soft, as the tp in the rooms are made out of the mulch from out front. If you have any complaints about the room, just ask the half naked Mexican that travels the hallways from time to time. The fridge and microwave are newer and spotless, all the furniture matches, and the view of the heliport out back is to die for! The ventilation in the rooms isn't the greatest so make sure not to stop at white castle before you check in! If you're claustrophobic, you might not like the elevator but don't worry...it will get you to your floor sometime before check-out time. All in all, for the price, amenities, breakfast, free parking, location, and laughter this place brings us...we will continue to stay here when we travel to Indy each and every time! I've stayed in WAY worse places!

Reviews.Title: “Some kind of inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: lonestar_queen
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of La Quinta for 2 years. But I was sort of disappointed this time. Room wasn't so wide, but it was clean and newly renovated. Room has a flat screen TV and Micro-fridge. Shampoo and body lotion in the bathroom were Days Inn brand's(this hotel is the former Days Inn). Bathroom was clean as well. However, the layout wasn't comfortable, bathroom and sink were right close to the door. On the negative side, I never got housekeeping service in my room. The last day, when I went out, I asked for front desk person to tell housekeepers to clean up my room. More than 2 hours later, I got back to hotel. Still, it seemed no one came into my room. Another thing, though it's not hotel's fault. Someone came up to my room at 4:30am, knocking the door TOO LOUDLY for a few minutes. I was woken up by that terrific noise. I was in my room alone, so scared! However, the desk staff was kind and helpful. The location and price were great. If you can stand the occasional inconvenience, I think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BookSlinger
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Indiana Convention Center and stayed at LaQuinta Downtown instead of The Westin to save money. My impression was that La Quinta has a bad rep from its past life as a different hotel chain. It was a good little walk from the Convention Center, very invigorating after conference sitting. I wondered why the hotel was practically empty. The service was great. It was clean. Parking was free! Unfortunately, the vending machines were empty and there wasn't anywhere close to eat dinner. The staff gave me several takeout menus. The breakfast bar was the best I've seen in a chain motel, all for me and one other customer. I felt I got a good deal and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Newly Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonw222
Reviews.Content: This hotel was newly renovated so please ignore the previous reviews. My room had a flat panel TV, leather chair, new, very comfortable bed. The staff was great, the location is right downtown, and the price of the room was about 40% less than the other hotels close by. If I'm ever in Indianapolis again, this is where I'm staying.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 401 East Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46204
